title.narrative: SOUTH-SOUTH COOPERATION

description.narrative: By 2016, equity, gender equality, CRC and CCC principles are increasingly reflected in Brazil's South-South/triangular and international humanitarian initiatives, and programmes., which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Birth Registration, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Economic And Social Policy General, Education â€“ General, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Learning Outcomes, Nutrition â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Public Finance And Local Governance, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, government institutions addressing child rights, equitable and sustainable development results for boys, girls and women, are empowered to share good practices through exchange of knowledge, skills, resources, including technology and information, between and among stakeholders as contemplated in Brazilian Government Horizontal cooperation triangular initiatives.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, equity, gender equality, CRC and CCC principles are increasingly reflected in Brazil?s South-South/triangular andinternational humanitarian initiatives, and programmes.

description.narrative: Despite political changes in Brazil, notable progress was achieved in 2016, including formalization of the trilateral south-south cooperation with Ethiopia around Water, Sanitation and Hygiene; public policy advocacy results in Algeria, Guatemala, Angola, Nepal and Paraguay on inclusive child-centred social protection; and capacity development in Sao Tome X Principe. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Existence of tools to address children's and adolescents' rights in Brazil's horizontal and triangular cooperation agenda, projects and initiatives

target.value: 2016:M&E framework developed, with indicators to measure HSSC identified, CRC principles, norms and standards included in new HSSC law focusing on equity.

actual.value: 2016:BCO, together with the Brazilian Government, developed a set of guidelines on how to engage with the Government of Brazil and UNICEF through Trilateral South-South Cooperation (TSSC). To support the dissemination of such guidelines and to facilitate communication and exchanges of knowledge between c

title.narrative: Existence of a center of excellence in Brazil, developing applied research on children's and adolescents' rights, in order to support Brazil's national and international development agenda.

actual.value: 2016:Following the signature of the MoU (in 2015) with the Court of Justice of the Federal District, which stipulated the first step towards the development of a centre of excellence focused on children's and adolescent's rights with an international approach, discussions are currently ongoing with regar

title.narrative: Number of South-South or triangular cooperation initiatives developed and implemented guided by ARA principles

actual.value: 2016:Target met1 project document was formally signed throughout the first semester of 2016, namely with the Government of Ethiopia around WASH. TSSC is also under way with Argentina, Guatemala, Paraguay, Algeria, Nepal, Angola and Sao Tome & Principe. Two recent examples are Kazakhstan and Argentina

title.narrative: Number of national institutions capacitated to ensure CRC principles are addressed and contemplated into Brazils horizontal and triangular cooperation agenda, projects and initiatives

target.value: 2016:10 national institutiona at the federal level and 5 at the state level (2016)

actual.value: 2016:Target metThe roll-out of the TSSC guidelines (in 2015 and 2016) provided great opportunities to promote capacity development/on-the-job training on CRC principles and RBM among managers and technical staff of Brazilian Government actors in 12 institutions

title.narrative: Lessons learned and good practices that address drivers of inequity and benefit the most disadvantaged systematized, documented validated and disseminated nationally and internationally to support Brazil's horizontal cooperation.

actual.value: 2016:2 Lessons learned.In 2016, a study on Lessons Learned from the UNICEF Brazil TSSC agenda was finalized, which will help inform ongoing discussions around the UNICEF SSC strategy globally as well as the CPD process of UNICEF Brazil.
